titleStmt.title: Description of University of Pennsylvania Ms. Codex 1717: Cours des experiences.

availability.licence: These images and the content of Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts Ms. Codex 1717: Cours des experiences. are free of known copyright restrictions and in the public domain. notesStmt.note: Title from title page (p. iii); alternate title from explicit (p. 257).

msIdentifier.repository: Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts

msContents.summary: A text from a physics course taught by a professor of philosophy named as Monsieur Quentin, divided into sections on topics such as porosity, hydrostatics, gravity, pneumatics, meteorology, electricity, light, colors, cold, sound, odors, and magnets, with numbered experiments following each topic. A table of contents is at the end of the volume.
msContents.textLang: French, with two classical quotations in Latin (p. 1, 7)

supportDesc.extent: 138 leaves : 170 x 115 (130 x 80) mm bound to 175 x 125 mm
supportDesc.foliation: Paper, i + 138 + i leaves; [i-iv], 1, [2-30], 31-221, 223-267, [268-273 (blank)], contemporary and near contemporary foliation in ink, modern foliation in pencil, upper outer corners.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Written in cursive script by a single hand.

binding.p: Contemporary (18th-century) sheep with flat gilt spine and title label Cours D'Exper, marbled endleaves, red edges, ribbon marker.

origin.p: Written in Clermont-Ferrand in 1768 (title page, p. iii).

history.provenance: Sold by Roger Gaskell Rare Books (Cambridge, England), 2014.
